0.question:
Refinery Process Production Flow

```mermaid
flowchart LR
 A1((Crude oil 1)) --> B[Distillation]
 A2((Crude oil 2)) --> B

 B --> C((Naphtha))
 B --> D((Light oil))
 B --> F((Heavy oil))
 B --> G((Residue oil))

 C --> H[Reforming]
 H --> I((Reforming gasoline))

 D --> J[Cracking]
 F --> J
 J --> K((Cracking gasoline))
 J --> T((Cracking oil))

 I --> L[Engine oil blend]
 C --> L
 K --> L
 L --> M((Premium engine oil))
 L --> N((Ordinary engine oil))
 

 P --> O((Fuel oil))
 D --> P[Kerosene/Fuel Oil Mixture]
 F --> P
 T --> P
 G --> P
 P --> Q((Kerosene))

 G --> R[Residue Treatment]
 R --> S((Lubricating Oil))

```

The refinery inputs two types of crude oil (Crude Oil 1 and Crude Oil 2). The crude oil first enters the distillation unit. The products and proportions of each barrel of crude oil after distillation are shown in Table C-1. The octane numbers of light, medium and heavy naphtha are 90, 80 and 70 respectively. 

| | Light naphtha | Medium naphtha | Heavy naphtha | Light oil | Heavy oil | Residue |
| ----- | -------- | -------- | -------- | ---- | ---- | ---- |
| Crude oil 1 | 0.1 | 0.2 | 0.2 | 0.12 | 0.2 | 0.13 |
| Crude oil 2 | 0.15 | 0.25 | 0.18 | 0.08 | 0.19 | 0.12 |

Part of the naphtha is directly used for engine oil mixing, and part is input into the reforming unit to obtain reformed gasoline with an octane number of 115. One barrel of light, medium and heavy naphtha can obtain 0.6, 0.52 and 0.45 barrels of reformed gasoline respectively. 

Part of the light oil and heavy oil obtained by distillation is directly used for mixing with kerosene and fuel oil, and part is passed through the cracking unit to obtain cracking gasoline and cracking oil. The octane number of pyrolysis gasoline is 105. After pyrolysis of 1 barrel of light oil, 0.68 barrels of pyrolysis oil and 0.28 barrels of pyrolysis gasoline are obtained; after pyrolysis of 1 barrel of heavy oil, 0.75 barrels of pyrolysis oil and 0.2 barrels of pyrolysis gasoline are obtained. Pyrolysis gasoline is used for engine oil mixing, and pyrolysis oil is used for kerosene and fuel oil mixing. 

Residual oil can be directly used for kerosene and fuel oil mixing, or for the production of lubricating oil. After treatment, 1 barrel of residual oil can produce 0.5 barrels of lubricating oil. 
The octane number of the high-grade engine oil mixed should not be less than 94, and the octane number of the ordinary one should not be less than 84. The octane number of the mixture is calculated by linear weighting according to the octane number and proportion of each oil before mixing. 

It is stipulated that the gas pressure of kerosene shall not exceed 1$kg/cm^2$, while the gas pressures of light oil, heavy oil, pyrolysis oil and residual oil are 1.0, 0.6, 1.5 and 0.05$kg/cm^2$ respectively. The calculation of gas pressure is based on the linear weighted calculation of the gas pressure and proportion of each mixed component.

In fuel oil, the ratio of light oil, heavy oil, cracking oil and residual oil should be 10:3:4:1. 

It is known that 20,000 barrels of crude oil 1 and 30,000 barrels of crude oil 2 are available every day. The maximum capacity of the distillation unit is 45,000 barrels per day, the reforming unit can reform up to 10,000 barrels of naphtha per day, and the maximum capacity of the cracking unit is 8,000 barrels per day. The daily output of lubricating oil should be between 500 and 1,000 barrels, and the output of high-end engine oil should not be less than 40% of ordinary engine oil. 

It is also known that the profits of the final products (yuan/barrel) are: high-end engine oil 700, ordinary engine oil 600, kerosene 400, fuel oil 350, lubricating oil 150. Try to formulate a plan for the refinery to maximize the total profit

Only the maximum value of the total profit needs to be given.

1.question:
Located under the shade of sycamore trees in the old city, Changning District People's Hospital has been a trusted medical center for surrounding residents for decades. With the aging of the population and the opening of the two-child policy, the number of outpatient visits and hospitalization needs have increased year by year, especially in the pediatric and emergency departments, which are often overcrowded. Head nurse Lin Mei has worked in this hospital for 15 years. She arrives at work at five in the morning every day to check the shift schedule and coordinate emergencies - for example, Xiao Li, who worked the night shift yesterday, suddenly had a fever, and twins were born in the obstetrics department in the early morning. She knows that scheduling is not just a table, but also about patient safety and the morale of the nursing team: newcomers need to be mentored by old staff, pregnant women cannot work night shifts, and nurses who work around the clock are prone to mistakes... But the hospital budget is limited, and human resource costs must be carefully calculated. Under the premise of meeting the demand for nurses in each time period, design an efficient and humane scheduling plan to avoid overwork or waste of manpower, and reserve flexible space for emergencies. 

People's Hospital is a district-level hospital in Changning District. The number of nurses on duty required in each time period of the hospital every day is shown in Table C-2. 

Table C-2

| Time period | 6:00-10:00 | 10:00-14:00 | 14:00-18:00 | 18:00-22:00 | 22:00-6:00 (next day) |
| -------- | ---------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ---------------- |
| Number of nurses required | 18 | 20 | 19 | 17 | 12 |

The nurses in this hospital work in five shifts, each 8 hours. The specific working hours are 2:00-10:00 for the first shift, 6:00-14:00 for the second shift, 10:00-18:00 for the third shift, 14:00-22:00 for the fourth shift, and 18:00-2:00 (next day). Each nurse works 5 shifts per week and is assigned to different days. There is a chief nurse who is responsible for the nurses' duty arrangements and duty plans, which should be relatively economical in terms of personnel or economy, and as reasonable as possible. It is the duty plan:

**Plan**: Each nurse works for 5 consecutive days, rests for 2 days, and is arranged from the first shift to the fifth shift from the first day of work. For example, if a nurse starts working on Monday, she will work the first shift on Monday, the second shift on Tuesday... the fifth shift on Friday; if another nurse starts working on Wednesday, she will work the first shift on Wednesday, the second shift on Thursday... the fifth shift on Sunday, and so on.

Establish a linear programming model to minimize the number of nurses on duty. You only need to give the minimum number of nurses.

2.question:
**Scenario background:** 

Sunshine Machinery Factory is a medium-sized manufacturing enterprise with a history of 30 years. It is located between the mottled factory buildings in the old industrial area and specializes in the OEM and R&D of precision parts. In recent years, with the explosive growth of new energy vehicles and automation equipment, the factory's orders have surged, but the problem of equipment aging has become increasingly prominent, and it is necessary to rely on existing resources to "squeeze" the maximum production capacity. Under the hard constraint of monthly equipment maintenance, the optimal production plan for January to June is formulated to reasonably allocate the production volume of 7 products to ensure balanced equipment load, timely delivery of orders, and maximize total profits. During the process, production scheduling needs to be adjusted dynamically. For example, when the horizontal drill is repaired in February, products that do not rely on the equipment (such as Type II) are given priority, and the relationship between high-profit products and equipment occupancy rate is weighed.

The factory has 4 grinders, 2 vertical drills, 3 horizontal drills, 1 boring machine and 1 planer, which are used to produce 7 products. The relevant equipment hours required for various products of the production unit and their profits are shown in Table C-3

Table C-3 Unit Required Equipment

| Equipment\(Unit hours required)\Product | I | II | III | IV | V | VI | VII |

| Grinding machine | 0.5 | 0.7 | — | — | 0.3 | 0.2 | 0.5 |
| Vertical drill | 0.1 | 0.2 | — | 0.3 | — | 0.6 | — |

| Planer | — | — | 0.01 | — | 0.05 | — | 0.05 |
| **Profit per piece/yuan** | 100 | 60 | 80 | 40 | 110 | 90 | 30 |

From January to June, the following equipment needs to be repaired: January - 1 grinder, February - 2 horizontal drills, March - 1 boring machine, April - 1 vertical drill, May - 1 grinder and 1 vertical drill, June - 1 planer and 1 horizontal drill. The repaired equipment cannot be arranged for production within the month

| May | 0 | 100 | 500 | 100 | 1000 | 300 | 0 |
| June | 500 | 500 | 100 | 300 | 1100 | 500 | 60 |

The monthly storage fee for each product that cannot be sold in the month is 5 yuan, but the storage volume of each product shall not exceed 100 pieces at any time. There is no inventory at the beginning of January, and it is required to store 50 pieces of each product at the end of June. If the factory works 24 days a month, two shifts a day, and each shift is 8 hours, assuming that the processing order of the products on various equipment is not considered, how should the factory arrange the plan to maximize the total profit? Shift1(2–10) covers period 1,5; etc. Assume that no storage fee is required for storage at the end of June, only the maximum total profit needs to be given.

3.question:
Ethiopian Adama Chemical Company (hereinafter referred to as **EAC**) was established in 1998. It was originally just a small ammonium nitrate workshop. Now it has developed into a regional leading enterprise integrating R&D, production, warehousing and international trade. The company's plant is close to the Addis Ababa-Djibouti railway trunk line and is only 72 kilometers away from the nearest inland port **Modjo Dry Port**; this logistics advantage is said to be one of the decisive factors in the board of directors' decision to build the plant. EAC's corporate vision is written on a blue plaque with white letters at the gate: "**Better Chemistry, Better Future**". According to internal communications, the company also plans to put into operation a 5 MW photovoltaic power station in 2026 to offset the pressure of carbon tax, but this project is not directly related to this question.

The Ethiopian Chemical Company is located in Adama and produces a variety of chemical products such as fertilizers, coatings and industrial chemicals. In 2025, the chemical company plans to formulate a production plan for the next two quarters. The company operates three core products: fertilizers (Product F), coatings (Product P) and industrial chemicals (Product C). Affected by the fluctuations in the international raw material market, local labor regulations, and equipment energy consumption tax policies, the company's management requires that the production schedule of the three main production lines be re-optimized while ensuring continuous supply and profitability. 

In recent years, the local rainy season (June-September) has been advanced or extended many times, resulting in delays in the land transportation of ore raw materials; in addition, the Ethiopian Central Bank has implemented stricter approval for foreign exchange allocations, which has also lengthened the supply cycle of imported additives. At the same time, the gradual implementation of the African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) has opened up new markets in East Africa and Southern Africa for the company, which can be said to be both an opportunity and a challenge. At the mid-term review meeting for fiscal year 2025, management decided that it was necessary to review internal production scheduling to ensure that the two core goals of **continuous supply** and **maximum profitability** remain resilient in the "changing external environment." 

In terms of time, within the plan, the company has locked in ten suppliers, each of which can supply up to 500 Tons of a certain nitrogen-phosphorus-potassium composite raw material, the excess cannot be effectively produced. In terms of equipment, historical safety records show that each main reactor is only allowed to be started up for a total of 125 days within the planned time; this quarter is operated at full capacity in double shifts (40 hours per shift), and no more than 3,000 tons of each product is allowed to avoid overproduction. In terms of manpower, there are 80 front-line operators, and the net working hours that each person can arrange on the production line in this plan shall not exceed 100 hours, and the rest of the time must be used for maintenance, training and rotation. In terms of the market, based on the sales department's tracking of domestic and foreign orders, the potential demand for fertilizers, coatings, and chemicals shall not exceed 2,000 tons, 1,500 tons, and 1,800 tons, respectively. The excess cannot be digested within the quarter. Upon investigation, during the planned time, the company's contract with customers requires that fertilizers must account for at least 25% of the total output (to ensure basic agricultural orders). At the same time, due to the signing of a framework agreement with a large customer, at least 1,000 tons must be provided. Tons of paint. In actual production, due to the high cost of switching the coolant of the device, the production volume of chemicals cannot exceed 0.8 times that of fertilizers (otherwise the equipment is overloaded), and nitrogen plays a dominant role in the raw materials. It is stipulated that the average raw material consumption per ton of product in production cannot exceed 0.65 tons. In order to enhance the brand image, all exported fertilizers must be packaged in newly designed biodegradable bags, but the packaging workshop has sufficient production capacity and does not constitute a bottleneck for the time being. In addition, the company will donate 1% of its profits to the local community fund every month to support vocational schools. Currently, this expenditure has been deducted from the profit coefficient. The cost data after deduction is shown in the following table, 

| Product | Profit/ton (US dollars) | Raw materials/ton (tons) | Machine time/ton (hours) | Labor/ton (hours) |
| ------ | -------------- | -------------- | ------------------ | ---------------- |
| Fertilizer | 200 | 0.5 | 0.8 | 0.6 |
| Paint | 300 | 0.7 | 1.0 | 0.8 |
| Chemicals | 250 | 0.6 | 0.9 | 0.7 |

In summary, choose the appropriate output of fertilizers, paints, and chemicals to maximize the total profit while satisfying the constraints. Only the maximum total profit needs to be given.

4.question:
Malaysia United Chemical Trading Co., Ltd. is a company focusing on the import and export of polymer materials. The company has a complete transportation network in Southeast Asia and maintains long-term cooperation with multiple ports, storage centers and logistics partners. The company currently operates four polyvinyl chloride polymer production plants P1-P4, which are located on different islands. In order to meet the needs of customers in many places in the region, it is necessary to transport products to four major demand locations, namely D1-D4, by land and sea. In order to ensure that the company maintains its cost advantage in the fierce market competition, the logistics department is seeking a set of methods that can minimize transportation costs while meeting the resources and contract constraints of all parties. The overall goal is to reasonably dispatch the shipments of each factory under the premise of the existing transportation network and resource capacity, to ensure that the needs of customers in various places are met on time, and to control the total transportation cost to the minimum. 

Recently, due to the limited amount of polyvinyl chloride polymers that can be provided by the four factories every day, the production capacity of each factory is closely related to the supply of raw materials. If the daily shipment volume of the factory exceeds its own production capacity, it will cause production plan conflicts. It is necessary to ensure that the total shipment volume of each factory does not exceed its supply capacity. On the demand side, each demand location is a local large-scale pipe manufacturer, and the downstream order volume is rigid. If the shipment volume is lower than the actual demand, it will lead to a breach of contract. Fines are incurred, so it must be ensured that the total volume of goods received by each demand location is not less than its actual demand. In terms of transportation, the transportation network consists of land trunk lines and ocean liners. The transportation costs and times of different routes vary significantly. In order to avoid the safety and insurance risks caused by excessive use of a single route, the transportation volume from each factory to the demand location should follow the maximum carrying capacity of the line and shall not exceed 2,000 tons. In addition, the company’s first factory P1 signed an agreement with its largest customer D1, requiring at least 300 units of goods, and the company’s fourth factory P4 signed an agreement with customer D1, requiring at least 200 units of goods to be shipped directly from the designated factory to the customer’s location. In order to maintain a long-term cooperative relationship. In addition, part of the shipment to D3 is a high-priority order jointly developed with a third-party brand. The company's internal agreement stipulates that at least 20% of D3's demand must be jointly undertaken by P2 and P3 factories to ensure the stability of supply to key customers. In order to support the development of the southern market, the volume of goods shipped by P4 factory to southern locations (D2 and D3) must account for more than 70% of its total shipments, while the volume of goods shipped by P2 factory to southern locations must be less than 50% of its total shipments to fulfill its cooperation commitment to the local government. Only the lowest total transportation cost needs to be given. 

The data table is as follows:

| Factory | Penang Factory P1 | Kuala Lumpur Factory P2 | Ipoh Factory P3 | Malacca Factory P4 |
| ---- | ---------- | ------------ | ---------- | ------------ |
| Supply | 1000 | 1500 | 1200 | 800 |

| Demand Location | Butterworth Transit Terminal D1 | Kuantan Manufacturing Park D2 | Klang Chemical Park D3 | Muar Distribution Center D4 |
| -------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------------ | -------------- |
| Demand | 900 | 1100 | 1000 | 500 |

| Transportation Cost | D1 | D2 | D3 | D4 |
| -------- | ---- | ---- | ---- | ---- |
| P1 | 10 | 15 | 12 | 20 |
| P2 | 14 | 13 | 16 | 18 |
| P3 | 12 | 17 | 11 | 15 |
| P4 | 19 | 14 | 18 | 13 |

5.question:
XYZ Asset Management Co., Ltd. is a fund management company focusing on diversified investment. The company relies on an asset network covering major markets around the world to provide clients with a stable return and risk-balanced investment portfolio. The company currently manages a portfolio worth $1 million, aiming to maximize annualized returns by adjusting the weights of various asset types such as stocks, real estate, bonds and time deposits under the premise of limited resource allocation. The overall goal is to optimize the allocation of various assets and maximize the total return of the portfolio under the premise of meeting liquidity and risk management requirements. Last year, the company negotiated with an insurance institution for alternative risk hedging products, but it was not implemented due to the mismatch between yield and cost. Only the maximum annualized return needs to be given.

In terms of total investment, all funds need to be invested in four assets to make full use of resources. At the same time, the fund stipulates that the total investment amount shall not exceed $1 million to meet regulatory requirements, and the sum of the any two investment amounts cannot exceed USD 700,000. In terms of liquidity, in order to ensure short-term funding needs, the total investment in time deposits and bonds shall not be less than 200,000 US dollars, and the maximum investment amount of time deposits shall not exceed 300,000 US dollars to reserve market liquidity space. 

In terms of income and risk management, the proportion of real estate investment shall not be less than 30% of the total investment to lock in a higher rate of return. Due to market volatility, the risk of stock investment is controlled below 400,000 US dollars, and the bond investment shall not be less than 100,000 US dollars to ensure the stability of the portfolio. 

The proportion of stocks to other assets cannot exceed half of the sum of real estate and bond investments. 

In terms of additional or priority constraints, in order to encourage investment diversity, in terms of diversification, in order to encourage asset diversification, at least one or more asset categories must be held in the investment portfolio to exceed 500,000 US dollars to be considered compliant. 

In terms of sustainable development, considering the ESG scoring requirements, the ESG scores of each asset are shown in the table below, and the weighted average ESG score of the portfolio must be no less than 0.7. 

In addition, the company's internal risk management regulations stipulate that the weighted average risk factor of the portfolio (the risk factor of each asset is shown in the table below) shall not be higher than 0.2. If it is higher, an additional risk reserve of 200,000 US dollars is required. 

| Asset type | Expected Annual Return | Minimum Investment (USD) | Maximum Investment (USD) | ESG Score | Risk Factor |
| ---------- | ------------ | ---------------- | ---------------- | ------- | -------- |
| Stock S | 6% | 100000 | 400000 | 0.5 | 0.30 |
| Real Estate R | 7% | 300000 | 1000000 | 0.7 | 0.25 |
| Bond B | 5% | 100000 | 1000000 | 0.8 | 0.10 |
| Certificate of Deposit C | 4% | 100000 | 300000 | 0.9 | 0.05 |
| Hedging Product D | 10% | 500000 | 1000000 | 0.3 | 0.8 |

6.question:
Nanshan District Nonglian Agricultural Technology Co., Ltd. is a modern agricultural enterprise integrating breeding, planting and food processing. The company operates several intelligent greenhouse factories and cooperates deeply with the local transportation network to realize the closed-loop supply chain management of "field-factory-market". The company is careful in the input of resources such as land, irrigation, and labor, and predicts market demand and cost fluctuations through big data. In order to maximize profits and meet sustainable development goals, it is exploring a land allocation optimization solution based on linear programming. The overall goal is to scientifically allocate the planting area of ​​seven major crops on the premise of ensuring the rational use of resources and rigid market demand to maximize total profits. Nonglian tried to introduce drone sprinkler technology in 2019, which can increase water resource utilization to 150%, but it was eventually abandoned due to unstable rainy season.

 In terms of resources, the total available farmland area is 7 hectares, of which block A is 5 hectares and block B is 2 hectares, and green corn, cabbage and tomatoes can only be planted in block A. The irrigation water source is limited to 5,000 cubic meters, and the total labor force is 400 people, with an average of 10 hours of work per person. These three types of resources need to be reasonably allocated among the seven crops to avoid idle or overloaded resources. In terms of the market, the maximum sales demand for each crop is different. If this upper limit is exceeded, there will be a risk of unsalable products. Therefore, the planting area of ​​each crop should not exceed its maximum demand. In terms of operating costs, the cultivation costs and per hectare of different crops are different. Profits vary from hectare to hectare, and it is necessary to take into account cost consumption while pursuing high profits to prevent excessive cost investment. In terms of diversity, the company hopes to plant at least 6 or more crops (if planted, the crops must be planted on at least 0.8 hectares) to diversify market risks. At the same time, it is required that the planting area of ​​melons (pumpkins) and roots (sweet potatoes) be balanced to optimize product structure. In terms of additional or priority constraints, in order to support the supply of raw materials to deep processing factories, the total planting area of ​​green corn and pumpkin must be no less than 3 hectares to ensure the stable procurement needs of the factory throughout the year. Only the maximum total profit needs to be given.

| Sweet potato | 10000 | 700 | 500 | 1 |

Morning Light Retail Supply Chain Co., Ltd. is a chain retail enterprise with a central warehouse, regional warehouses and multiple stores. Relying on the transportation network covering the southern region, the company implements the four-level inventory and distribution management of "factory-central warehouse-regional warehouse-retail store". In order to cope with market fluctuations and cost pressures, the company's logistics and operations team hopes to optimize ordering and transportation decisions through periodic review strategies, and minimize ordering costs, holding costs and transportation costs within a total of 15 cycles while ensuring that each store is constantly stocked, and reasonably utilize inventory resources.

On the supply side, in each cycle, regional warehouses can choose to place orders separately to request replenishment and replenishment quantities from the central warehouse. At the same time, regional warehouses can redistribute inventory to various retail stores. The ordering cost must be fixed and the replenishment quantity must be received immediately after a single order is placed. The company relies on a nationwide transportation network to deliver tens of thousands of policy materials to local sales teams in a timely manner. The entire operation is inseparable from the fine control and scheduling of costs/resources. The group's senior management hopes to optimize policy allocation and production decisions through operations research models to meet customer needs and maintain market competitiveness under the premise of controlling total costs.

 On the supply side, the company needs to place production orders to three printing factories A, B, and C each period. Each printing factory is responsible for a fixed type of insurance policy, that is, there are three types of insurance policies, A, B, and C. The company wants to minimize the sum of deductibles and other costs. The company owns 100 hectares of arable land and mainly grows crops such as wheat, corn, soybeans and cotton. As market demand changes, management hopes to reasonably allocate the planting area of ​​various crops under limited land and resource conditions to maximize economic benefits. The company faces many challenges, including how to maximize the planting profits of different crops while ensuring the supply of labor, irrigation water and fertilizer resources. In addition, in order to adapt to the needs of soil nutrients and market diversification, management has put forward some specific requirements for the planting ratio of each crop. The company needs to ensure the optimal use of resources and reasonable crop allocation plans. Ensuring agricultural production not only meets market demand, but also ensures sustained economic benefits. 

**On the supply side**, the company has 100 hectares of arable land available for planting, but the land area required for each crop is different, and all land must be planted with crops without waste. The output profit per hectare of wheat, corn, soybeans and cotton is also different. Therefore, it is necessary to reasonably allocate limited arable land resources in order to achieve maximum profit. **On the transportation side**, considering soil nutrients, management requires that the planting area of ​​all crops shall not be less than 10 hectares, and the planting area of ​​wheat shall not be less than 20 hectares. The planting area of ​​cotton is limited and shall not exceed 30 hectares. In order to cope with the diversification of market demand, corn and cotton The total planting area shall not exceed 80 hectares. 

The company is located in a mild climate area with good water source conditions, but the weather has changed greatly recently, and the supply of water resources may be affected to a certain extent, especially if the water consumption exceeds 80% of the total supply, the insurance mechanism will be triggered. If water resources are still needed, additional labor will be needed to transport water resources to facilitate timely replenishment of the remaining 20% ​​of water resources to irrigate the land without interference, and every 1 unit of irrigation water requires 2 units of labor, and in order to protect water resources, the use of water resources must not exceed the maximum limit. At the same time, fertilizers may also encounter the problem of insufficient fertilizers, which involves fertilizer transportation, which also needs to be purchased from outside Purchase. If for every additional unit of fertilizer consumed, 2 additional workers are needed to ensure normal purchase, a maximum of 20 tons of fertilizer will be consumed. The capital expenditure of the purchase part has nothing to do with the unit profit and does not need to be considered. 

Assume that a worker can provide 2 hours of labor. Currently, the company has recruited a total of 500 workers. In this area, it is necessary to choose how many workers to send to plant a certain crop, and the total labor of the workers cannot be less than the required labor. 

In order to optimize the use of resources, the company hopes to allocate land resources to different crops as efficiently as possible and provide a dispatch plan for workers to different crops, but at the same time, it also needs to ensure that the various constraints specified are not violated. Give the maximum profit value. 

Data table

| Wheat | 300 | 10 | 5 | 2 |
| Corn | 400 | 8 | 7 | 3 |
| Soybean | 250 | 5 | 4 | 1 |
| Cotton | 500 | 12 | 9 | 4 |

| Resource type | Supply |
| ------------------ | ------ |
| Workers | 500 |
| Maximum limit of irrigation water resources | 500 |
| Available resources of fertilizer resources | 150 |
| Cultivated land area | 100 |

The consultant team of the Nutrition and Health Management Center recently accepted a commission from a newly established healthy meal catering company to help it design a "one-week fat-reducing energy package" plan for obese people that can meet strict nutritional needs and control costs. The company purchased four energy packages with different ratios (A, B, C, D), and ate them with fresh vegetables. The energy packages are ready to eat after opening the bag and cannot be stored, while vegetables can be purchased and cut and eaten as needed. The company hopes to reduce the total weekly cost as much as possible while ensuring that there is at least one day of "motivational meal" with calorie relaxation in a week (to increase the motivation of customers to continue to stick to it). The consultant team needs to establish a linear programming model and provide a procurement and allocation plan based on the ingredients, costs and nutritional catering requirements of each energy package provided by the company. The company's goal is to minimize the total cost of the week under multiple constraints such as meeting the upper and lower limits of nutrition and calories, the purchase amount of the package and the daily intake limit, so as to provide a standardized formula for subsequent large-scale market launch.

22.question:
Xinyuan Hydropower Co., Ltd. is promoting the "smart watershed" construction project. As one of the demonstration projects, Chenxi Reservoir has introduced a zoned water transfer scheduling system for the first time. Different downstream areas will directly receive the water released from the reservoir. At the same time, in the new round of green energy transformation, the power generation efficiency of Chenxi Reservoir has been raised to the main assessment indicator, and water supply demand has become a basic premise that must be guaranteed.

The company has set up a new power generation reward mechanism: due to the high initial head and good power generation efficiency, the power generation in the first two periods is calculated as twice the water release; and the head decreases in the later period, the third and fourth periods are calculated as twice the water release. The power generation in a period is equal to the water release itself. In order to cope with the diversified regional water supply needs, Chenxi Reservoir needs to reasonably allocate the total water release according to the maximum demand limits of different regions, and avoid the system burden caused by excessive water supply in various regions. 

The company hopes to formulate a scientific and reasonable four-period scheduling plan this time to **maximize the total power generation** and ensure that the water supply demand in the downstream area is not affected. 

**In terms of supply**, the current water volume of Chenxi Reservoir is 1 million cubic meters, with a fixed natural inflow in each period, and all the inflow enters the reservoir capacity. There is no natural loss during the dispatch period, and it can be dispatched freely, but it cannot be discarded or artificially increased. **In terms of demand**, downstream demand is divided into two areas, area A and area B, and each period has a corresponding maximum water supply demand limit. The sum of the actual water supply in each area should be equal to the current water release, and each shall not exceed the corresponding maximum demand limit. 

**In terms of transportation**, the total water release of the reservoir in each period shall not exceed 1 million cubic meters, and the water release must be greater than or equal to 0. The final inventory of the reservoir in each period is maintained between 0 and 2 million cubic meters. At the end of each period, The change in water volume must satisfy the water balance: that is, the reservoir storage is equal to the previous period's storage plus the current period's inflow minus the current total water release. 

**In terms of power generation**, the power generation of Chenxi Reservoir is directly related to the water release. In the first and second periods, the power generation is twice the water release, and in the third and fourth periods, the power generation is 1 times the water release. In addition, in order to maintain overall operational safety, the company requires that after the end of the 4 periods, the Chenxi Reservoir's storage volume must not be less than 200,000 cubic meters in preparation for the next period of scheduling. Based on the above scenario and description, please give the calculated total power generation.

Now it is planning to customize a six-month plan. production plan.

In terms of demand, the monthly demand for the four products will be different in the next six months, but the sum of the demand for the four products in any month must be equal to the total market demand, and no product should be backordered at the end of the month. 

In terms of inventory balance, a separate inventory account must be established for each product. The inventory at the end of the month is equal to the inventory of the previous month plus the sum of the regular production and overtime production of the current month minus the demand for the product in the current month, and all inventory at the end of the month must be non-negative.

27.question:
Vice Chairman Song asked the finance, sales and production managers to come to his office to discuss the production quantity of tomato products in this production season. The tomatoes purchased according to the procurement plan this year have arrived at the processing plant and will start processing and production next Monday. Hong Mudan Canned Food Company is a medium-sized enterprise that produces and sells various canned fruits and vegetables. It has its own brand trademark in the Northeast. Financial Manager Qian Yuan and Sales Manager Xiao arrived at the office first.

Production Manager Liu arrived a few minutes late. He got the latest evaluation of the quality of the arrived tomatoes from the production inspector. According to the latest inspection report, according to the inspection report, about 20% of the 300,000 kg tomatoes are grade A, 70% are grade B, and the rest are grade C (score 1), and grade C can only be used to make tomato sauce. Tomato sauce can be produced from grade B and grade C tomatoes. At the same time, although grade C tomatoes are of lower quality , but it can be used to sell to the research department at 0.001 yuan/kg. How to improve the quality of C-grade tomatoes by research and development? If the sales volume is greater than 20,000 kg, there is an 80% chance of successful research and development, so that the remaining C-grade tomatoes that have not been sold to the research and development department can reach a C-grade quality of 4 points when making tomato sauce. If more than 10,000 kg of tomatoes are not sold (the same research and development is carried out when the sales volume is 0), then there is only a 20% probability of success. When we calculate, we take the average of the scores as the C-grade quality after research and development. 

Vice President Song asked Xiao about the market demand for canned tomatoes next year. Xiao replied that according to the actual demand estimate, all the canned tomatoes produced by the company can be sold, but the demand for tomato juice and tomato sauce is limited and shown in Table C-10. He said that the sales price is set according to the company's long-term market strategy, and the potential sales demand is predicted based on these prices. 

Table C-10 Demand forecast and raw material usage

| Product | Sales price (yuan/can) | Raw material usage (kg/can) | Demand forecast (can) ≤ |
| :------- | :---------------: | :---------------: | :-------------: |
| Whole tomatoes | 4.00 | 1.8 | 800000 |
| Tomato juice | 4.50 | 2.0 | 50000 |
| Tomato sauce | 3.80 | 2.5 | 80000 |

After reading Xiao's demand forecast, Qian Yuan put forward his opinion. He believes that the company "should use all tomatoes as much as possible for the production of whole canned tomatoes, and the production situation this year is quite good." 36.question:
Tianxin Concentration Area is located in a newly emerging large residential community in the city. There are 12 residential communities and 3 schools within a radius of 500 meters. According to the market research report of a business consulting agency, the family structure in this area is mainly young families and retirees, and daily consumption presents the characteristics of "high frequency and small batch". The building where the supermarket is located was originally converted from a community activity center. Its unique four-zone structure not only brings flexibility in space utilization, but also puts higher requirements on the scientific layout of goods. Retail industry research shows that reasonable commodity zoning can significantly increase customer stay time and associated purchase rate, but improper layout may lead to chaotic traffic flow and reduced shopping experience. The supermarket planning is an important measure to improve the community's "15-minute living circle", which directly affects the daily life convenience of surrounding residents. A scientific commodity zoning plan can not only optimize customer shopping paths and improve store operation efficiency, but also promote cross-selling of different categories of goods through reasonable consumer traffic line design. The implementation effect of this project will provide a valuable reference case for the planning and layout of community commercial facilities of the same type, and will have a demonstrative significance for promoting the standardized development of community retail industry. 

A convenience supermarket is planned to be opened in this residential area, selling the following four categories of goods

37.question:
Magic Square is an ancient mathematical game that can be traced back to the records of the Luoshu in China in 1900 BC. This arrangement of filling consecutive natural numbers into a square matrix so that the sum of each row, column and diagonal is equal not only has mathematical aesthetic value, but also has a profound impact in cryptography, statistics and art design. Modern research shows that there are 8 basic solutions to the 3×3 magic square, and many variants can be derived through rotation and mirroring. In computer science, magic square generation algorithms are often used as benchmark cases for testing combinatorial optimization methods, and their constraint satisfaction characteristics are isomorphic to practical applications such as scheduling problems and resource allocation. This problem is essentially a typical constraint satisfaction problem (CSP), and its modeling ideas can be extended to engineering fields such as production scheduling and traffic flow balancing. Solving magic squares through integer programming can not only verify the inherent laws of mathematical symmetry, but also provide a method reference for dealing with more complex discrete optimization problems. Magic square research is still a classic case in the teaching of combinatorial mathematics and discrete optimization, reflecting the close connection between mathematical theory and applied practice. 

Fill the numbers 1, 2, ..., 9 into the 9 cells A, B, ..., H, I in Figure C-17, so that the sum of the numbers in each row, column and two main diagonals is 15. Try to establish an integer programming model and solve it. If the number in block A is 4, what is the number in block I? 

Figure C-17

```
+---+---+---+
| A | B | C |
+---+---+---+
| D | E | F |
+---+---+---+
| G | H | I |
+---+---+---+
```
